fields.description:
Tom created are review from a commit on atlaseye, and the commit message contained a jira key.
Tom was shown the "suggest exstitng review" screen, but hit "create new review" at the bottom.
After hitting that button, it takes between 15-30s for the next screen to come up (we tried multiple times).

If you do the same thing with a commit that does not contain a jira key, then it happens "real fast".

I suspect automatically filling the linked-jira field is taking too long (too long talking to jira?) We should make it faster or asynchronous.
fields.summary: Creating a new review is slow when Crucible auto-links the JIRA key

fields.description:
Currently, whenever we create a new user for FishEye, this user will be a "Active Crucible user" as well (by default). The problem arise when the administrator want to open Crucible for certain users only (selective). For example, a system with max 100 FishEye user and max 25 Crucible user. The administrator would like to select 25 out of 100 existing FishEye users to access Crucible, then the administrator has to disable those first 25 users (the access into Crucible) and re-enable for the other selected users. This create more works for administrator.

Suggested resolution:
# Allow administrator to choose whether to set property *Crucible Active User* as default
# User browser allows administrator to check/uncheck property *Crucible Active User* in one shot.
fields.summary: Allow administrator to choose whether a newly created user should have Crucible access by default.

fields.description:
Please refer to the support ticket [CRC-807|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-807]. There is a XSS issue when generating the Crucible filter with the following URL. 

For example;
* http://localhost:8060/cru/?filter=%3c/style%3e%3cscript%3ealert(document.cookie)%3c/script%3e

which will execute a javascript pop up with cookie information. See the attached screen shot

*This is not reproducible in Crucible 2.0.*
fields.summary: XSS issue in filter parameter

fields.description:
*Problems:*
Inside a review with few or many files (e.g. 10), the IE7 is giving intolerable slowness in responsive, especially in following actions:
# mouse hovers on file link (left panel)
# switch between files
# opening a file for review

The similar kinds of action do not create the slowness issue in other browsers (they need some time to load, but not as slow as IE7.)

** Note: the files in review could be just a few line of texts for testing purpose.
fields.summary: Slow Responsive in IE7 within Crucible Review

fields.description:
In previous releases this was selected by default. 

This proves handy when customers want to disable or remove their repo, which would cause all their existing reviews to fail. If they want to fix this, this need to enable [Store the contents of files in reviews|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/HwftCQ], and then hit all of their reviews to cache them, which is a big PITA.
fields.summary: "Store the contents of files in reviews" is not selected as default for newly created projects

fields.description:
There is a problem with adding users to reviews on the Edit Review->Review Details page if the username contains either "." or "@"symbols. 
Steps to reproduce:
1) install Crucible Standalone
2) add 7+users through Crucible's Admin (use "." as part of the username e.g. joe.smith)
3) create a review and navigate to Edit Review->Review Details screen
4) start typing in the name of any of the users added previously and select the username suggested
5) username will not be added to the list of reviewers!

Users whose usernames do not contain "." or "@" can be successfully added to the review. Problem only occurs for usernames with "." and "@" symbols. Problem occurs both with embedded HSQL as well external MySQl database.
fields.summary: Select Reviewers textbox on the Edit Review->Review Details screen will not add user to a review if the username contains "." or"@" symbols

fields.description:
The "Statement of Objectives" field does not save when using Internet Explorer 7. This is not reproducible in Firefox 3.

Steps to reproduce:
# Edit an existing review e.g go to "Reviews" tab and click on a review id
# Click on "Edit Review" button
# Enter some texts in the "Statement of Objectives" field e.g see this [screen shot|^statement.PNG]
# Click "Done"
# Notice that the changes were not picking up. e.g see this [screen shot|^error.PNG]

fields.description:
The behaviour implemented on:

https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/contrib/crucible/crucible-svn-scm-plugin/trunk/src/main/java/com/atlassian/crucible/plugins/scm/svn/SvnSCMRepository.java?r=25396#l110

is flawed and causes Crucible to mess up iterative reviews. When a new revision is added to the review, this method is called to identify the parent for that revision. Since this method simply returns "revid - 1", this often represents a changeset that is totally unrelated to the file we're looking for. This in turn causes Crucible to interpret the file a totally different file (rather than simply an extra revision to the existing frx) and creates a new frx for it.
fields.summary: LiteSVN implementation returns incorrect rev for SCMRepository.getDiffRevisionKey()

Possibly, this could be added into Profile Settings of each user.

fields.description:
Can we review a file which is not kept in any SCM (say SVN or Clearcase)? For example if I have a file CPNA.java in C: / drive and I know that I can upload this to perform this review. But when I modify this file, how will I be able to continue the review? I can only see that modified file shall be uploaded separately and there is no way that we can make the review synchronized as review comments remain isolated from each other. Please assume that I do not have any SCM and I just want to review a file in my file system.

 

Meanwhile, we have procured crucible. Please let me know if any resolution is possible in this.
fields.summary: How can i review a file using file system?

fields.description:
The new feature requests are for the Upload Tab in Crucible Review:
# Allows the ability to upload multiple files to a review at once in the upload tab (i.e. add file to review, then file to diff. Then another file to review and another file to diff, without having to do them one at a time). 
# Support multiple revisions/iterations (i.e. multiple upload) so that the revision slider works for a file. (If the file has the same path, then it should be added as a new version. 

A customer has made the suggestion:
#  Add the ability to put in a directory instead. I.e. "Directory to review", "Directory to diff with", so that you can upload multiple files at once.
fields.summary: Support uploading multiple files at once in the upload tab ad support Multiple revisions for the one file

fields.description:
We should poll for state changes to a review (via https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2185#c18795).

Consider a review that is currently open.
1. You render that review.
2. Someone else summarizes and closes the review.
3. You start trying to make comments, but will just get back errors.

Instead, you should get a 'review updated' notice.
fields.summary: Poll for state changes

fields.description:
Re: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Browsing+Projects

See comment:
"In the screen shot, it shows users starting/stopping progress, resolving items, and other JIRA actions.  I can't seem to get this level of detail to show after setting up my JIRA server mapping in Crucible.  I get commits with the JIRA ticket numnber but that's all.  Do the ticket numbers in the screenshot represent JIRA tickets or Crucible Reviews?  What am I doing wrong?  More explanation on this page please :)"
fields.summary: clarify 'Browsing Projects' page in User Guide
Revision slider misaligned

fields.description:
Non-empty folders (that are FRXs in the review) don't have comment counts in the navigation tree.

Empty folders (that are FRXs in the review) do have comment counts.

fields.summary: Opening a review with a 2mb patch causes the review to take 1 minute to open

fields.description:
from https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Feedback+on+Atlaseye

!https://extranet.atlassian.com/download/attachments/1743622202/CRU_whos_reviewed.jpg!

I think we could tighten this up - we use faded avatars in some places, ticks in others.
fields.summary: make it clearer who has finished the review

fields.description:
from https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Feedback+on+Atlaseye

It's not clear how to add changed files to review 

!https://extranet.atlassian.com/download/thumbnails/1743622202/CRU_revisions.jpg!
fields.summary: make it more clear how changed files can be added to a review

fields.description: currently many users report getting to the end of a review, clicking complete, and then being confronted with the "unreviewed files" dialog. Investigate ways to make marking files as reviewed for automatic / intuitive.
fields.summary: mark files as reviewed when you scroll past them

fields.description:
from https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Feedback+on+Atlaseye

Unclear what checkbox between Reply & Leave Unread does given both of those options look like links.
Go to next comment button seems pointless when I can see all of the comments, so I suspect it does something else, but because I have no idea what that could be I have no incentive to click it and find out, so its ignored.

!https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Feedback+on+Atlaseye!
fields.summary: disambiguate checkbox / Leave unread in comment panel

fields.description:
from https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Feedback+on+Atlaseye

In a code review, you should be able to click the truncated text icon to show it. 

!https://extranet.atlassian.com/download/attachments/1743622202/expand-text.jpg!
fields.summary: selectively / incrementally expand source view truncations

fields.description:
Empty folders and files in the same directory are incorrectly ordered (see screenshot).

Folders should always precede files in the same directory.
fields.summary: Empty folders are incorrectly ordered

fields.description:
From https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Feedback+on+Atlaseye

Unable to add a changeset to an existing review that isn't suggested. 

!https://extranet.atlassian.com/download/attachments/1743622202/Add%20to%20existing%20review.jpg!

The dialog could be expanded to include an "Other reviews" section that can be expanded to show all reviews the user has permission to add the changeset to. This could conceivably be just an auto-complete field instead?
fields.summary: "Add to Review" dialog should allow user to add the changeset to *any* open review

fields.description: Creating a review from the first subversion commit, where the root directory, {{/}}, is included, results in {{/}} not being rendered in the navigation tree and a _review updated_ notice after every load.
fields.summary: Review from first svn commit always gives updated notice

fields.description:
While viewing: https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/cru/CR-CLOV-55, 
I got:

Your request was unable to be processed
org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException
Could not execute JDBC batch update
Batch entry 0 update cru_base_star_model set cru_string_key1=clover, cru_string_key2=34610, cru_string_key3=NULL, cru_string_key4=NULL, cru_string_key5=NULL, cru_int_key1=NULL, cru_int_key2=NULL, cru_int_key3=NULL, cru_int_key4=NULL, cru_int_key5=NULL, cru_text_key1=NULL, cru_text_key2=NULL, cru_user_name=npellow, cru_date_created=1246408395714, cru_label=This is beteal guice where cru_star_id=3 was aborted. Call getNextException to see the cause.
ERROR: current transaction is aborted, commands ignored until end of transaction block
You are running release CR2.0.0 FE2.0.0 (build-410 2009-06-29), please report your release number when reporting bugs.
fields.summary: GenericJDBCException thrown on atlaseye
"Create Review" on browse page does not add-to-review, but always creates a new review

fields.description: For a changeset that adds an empty folder, the folder isn't rendered with a folder icon in the navigation tree.
fields.summary: Empty folder doesn't have folder icon in tree

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create review from changeset {{https://atlaseye-qa.atlassian.com/atlaseye/changelog/bamboo/?cs=92171}}
2. Edit Review > Changesets > Go to changeset 92175
3. Tick ResourceRestApiAcceptanceTest.java from changeset 92175
4. Untick PlanResourceRestApiAcceptanceTest.java from 92171
5. Click 'Done'

Expected:
- Review created works as normal.

Actual:
- You get a 'review updated' notice as soon as the review finishes loading.
fields.summary: FRXs with the same path are collapsed in the navigation tree

fields.description:
1. The remove revision x's are active, but clicking them produces a spinner which doesn't get hidden, and a response:
{code}
{ errorMsg:"",
 worked: true,
 frxExists: false,
 payload: "
    


    
",
 diff: "",
 slider: "",
 frxModelLoader: "






function() {
var frx = new Frx('', review);
frx.setBinary()
.setDirectory
()
.setNewSinceComplete()
.setComplete()


.setLoaded(true)

.setVisibleToRevision('')
.setVisibleFromRevision
('')
.setVisibleToSCMRevision('')
.setVisibleFromSCMRevision('')
.setColspan()
.setRenderTime
(new Date(1246343652695));
review.addFrx(frx);


};

",
 value: 0 }
{code}

If you refresh the page, the file has been removed from the review.
fields.summary: Patch reviews shouldn't allow deletion of frxrevisions

fields.description:
To make responding to change requests easier, and to minimise the occurrences of comments with the sole contents of "done", add a check box to comments that the owner can use to indicate that the change is complete.

Other reviews would see a notification similar to "defect" or "draft", but with "done" in a fetching shade of success green.
fields.summary: Add a Done checkbox to comments to allow a quick acknowledgement of completion
